oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nativity Scene at Centennial Park, Nashville, Tennessee, between 1953 and 1967
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: A view of the Nativity exhibition at Centennial Park, between 1953 and 1967. The origins of this special exhibit began in 1953 when Nashville businessman Fred Harvey and Harvey’s Department Store began sponsoring this exhibition at Centennial Park. It was on view yearly during the Christmas season. Thousands of Nashvillians were drawn to Centennial Park by the beauty of this life-size crèche. The sculpted design was created by Guido Rabacini and made by the Silvestri Art Manufacturing Company of Chicago at a cost of approximately $20,000. The last year the nativity scene was on display was 1967. Forms part of the Bill Goodman Photographic Slides Collection. 1 35 mm negative.
